meanings.definition: To influence or persuade someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: She sweys her friends to join her for a movie night.
meanings.sent2: He always sweys his siblings to play outside with him.
meanings.sent3: The clever cat sweys the mouse into sharing its cheese.
meanings.sent4: The charismatic leader sweys the crowd with his powerful speech.
meanings.sent5: The colorful advertisement sweys customers to try the new product.

meanings.definition: To move or swing back and forth.
meanings.sent1: The branches of the tree sweys gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: The pendulum sweys steadily from side to side.
meanings.sent3: The boat sweys on the calm waters of the lake.
meanings.sent4: The child's swing set sweys back and forth in the playground.
meanings.sent5: The curtain sweys gracefully in the open window.

meanings.definition: A tendency or inclination towards a particular opinion or action.
meanings.sent1: She has a strong sweys towards helping others in need.
meanings.sent2: His sweys towards adventure lead him to explore new places.
meanings.sent3: The cat's sweys for napping in the sun are well-known.
meanings.sent4: The student's sweys for studying late at night surprised his classmates.
meanings.sent5: The company's sweys towards innovation set it apart from competitors.
